basics.name: Olivia Murray
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science, specializing in Cyber Security, in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

courses: Discrete Math for Computer Science I (ICS 141)
Discrete Math for Computer Science I (ICS 141)
Discrete Math for Computer Science II (ICS 241)

work.summary: Developing curriculum for 4th and 5th graders under the Ka Pilina Noeau grant
highlights: Design projects for students that incorporate math and science Common Core standards

work.summary: Managing website content and clerical duties

volunteer.summary: Coach and Mentor to cadets for national cybebr defence competition
highlights: Teach students how to secure a computer
Prepare students for competition, as well as real life scenarios
Participate in various competitions such as National Cyber League
Attend special talks from professionals in the cyber defense field

volunteer.summary: Mentor and planning consultant for NexTech STEM promoting events
highlights: Project manager for the NexTech One-Day Workshop in March 2018
Participate in monthly games open to the public
Organize the half-time entertainment for games

awards.title: University of Hawaii at Manoa Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: Regents Scholarships are full-tuition waiver scholarships awarded to 20 outstanding freshmen who receive an SAT total score of at least 1950 (old SAT) / 1380 (new SAT) or ACT combined score of at least 29, maintain at least a 3.5 GPA in academic subjects in high school, and whose extracurricular achievements are shown to be remarkable.

awards.title: THINK STEM Scholarship Fund
awards.summary: Awarded to students who will work in a STEM occupation on the Hawai'i Island.
